Introduction
============

A *NURBS curve*, which is an acronym for *Non-Uniform Rational B-Spline
curve*, is a generalization of both and curves. NURBS are commonly used
in computer graphics, computer-aided design (CAD), engineering (CAE),
and manufacturing (CAM).

Definition
==========

A NURBS curve is a parametric curve defined by its , a set of weighted
control points, and a knot vector. It is defined as

$$c(u) = \frac { \sum_{i=0}^{n} N_{i,p}(u) w_i P_i} {\sum_{i=0}^{n} N_{i,p}(u) w_i} \quad\quad 0 \leq u \leq 1$$

where $u$ is the parameter, $p$ is the , $N_{i,p}$ are the B-spline
basis functions, $P_i$ are the control points and $w_i$ are the weights.
